content.question:
The following table shows the probability distribution for the number of books a student typically buys at the annual book fair held at an elementary school.
Number of Books 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 Probability 0.35 0.20 0.15 0.10 0.07 0.08 0.04 0.01 
Let the random variable <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of books a student buys at the next book fair. What is the expected value of <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>Â ?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.8: Mean and Standard Deviation of Random Variables

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
